c74object.name: the.file.manager
c74object.digest: Manage import/export settings for the.jit.renderer~ remote children objects
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze © 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Automatic import/export of specified files after recording audio or data.
Send this object's output to an object hosting, recording and accumulating realtime data in a child to the.jit.renderer~

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context to bind to.

objarg.name: settings-dictionary
objarg.digest: Specify a named dictionary to query the directory (dir entry) from.
objarg.description: Inherited from parent patcher as #1_[dictionary], mostly likely #1_settings

objarg.name: data-object-type
objarg.digest: Specify the type of object hosting the data.

objarg.name: file-extension
objarg.description: Linked to data-object-type; png, jxf, wav, mov…

attribute.name: name
attribute.digest: Specify a unique name to write to
attribute.description: Received from parent patcherargs or typeroute~ connected to leftmost inlet. Specify a unique name to export to after completion of the capturing process, managed by the.jit.renderer~. The resulting filetype is JSON and can be re-exported/imported using the export and import messages, respectively.

attribute.name: filetype
attribute.digest: Specify the file extension (see the file-extension listing)
attribute.description: Specify the file extension (see the file-extension listing)

attribute.name: autowrite
attribute.description:
When set to '1' will export a file holding all recorded data as per the name listing to the dir specified in the.jit.renderer~ upon completion of recording.
Deactivate this setting when certain steps need to be undertaken before the file is to be saved. The rightmost inlet can receive a bang to write the file manually.

attribute.name: autoread
attribute.digest: Read a given data file on launch
attribute.description: When set to '1' will attempt to import a file holding all recorded data as per the name listing from the dir specified in the.jit.renderer~ on launch.

attribute.name: extension
attribute.digest: Specify a filename extension for disambiguation
attribute.description:
When provided as symbol, will format the filename based on the name listing and the given extension with an underscore.
Default: no additional extension.
